concept.title: Common Issues When Loading Paper
concept.shortdesc: Understanding the common issues encountered when loading paper into a typewriter ensures smooth operation, and prevents damage to the device as well as the paper.

dlentry.dd: When the paper release lever is unintentionally left open, the platen cannot grip the paper securely, causing slipping and misalignment. Ensuring the lever is fully closed restores proper paper tension.
Platen rollers may harden or lose friction over time. Cleaning can offer temporary improvement, but significant deterioration requires resurfacing or replacement.

A bent bail bar or cracked rollers prevents consistent pressure on the paper, leading to instability during typing. Replacement of worn or damaged components is often necessary for reliable operation.

Paper that is too thin may slip under the rollers, while thick paper can strain the feeding mechanism. Select a paper weight that is appropriate for your typewriter to prevent jams and feeding errors.
